kBIqwekS.question: When does responsibility of the operator end if he has to deliver a person in custody?

options.text: From the moment such person has been admitted into the corresponding state.
From the moment such person has passed the customs control.
From the moment such person has left the aircraft and entered the corresponding state.
From the moment such person has arrived in the corresponding state.

4sZ0iPAh.question: According to ICAO Annex 9 and in the case of customs clearance, when a passenger's baggage is delayed or mishandled, his/her unaccompanied baggage will...

options.text: be cleared under simplified arrangements.
NOT be cleared and will be subject to the taxes of the Contracting State.
NOT be loaded in the cargo hold and returned to the owner because baggage must travel with his/her owner.
be cleared if it weighs less than 12 kg.
need not to be accompanied by a passport or visa but it does not replace logbook or pilot's licence.
must be accompanied by a passport and pilot's licence.
must be accompanied by a passport or visa and logbook.
must be accompanied by a passport or visa and pilot's licence.

65A2Pev2.question: What do you use for a security search procedure during flight?

options.text: A checklist.

A search procedure is only used for ground operations. If an act of sabotage is suspected during flight, the passengers and cabin crew is expected to fasten their seatbelts and the pilot tries to land as soon as possible.
A metal detector.
Fire detecting systems.

gJKOW0fx.question: You are a passenger travelling internationally for a holiday in an ICAO contracting state. You have a valid passport and a visa recognized by the state you seek to enter. Upon arrival, according to Annex 9:

options.text: The state shall not require from you any other document of identification.
The state may require you to hold a CMC before granting you access into the state.
If your passport should expire and you are found inadmissible the state is required to remove you and fly you to your state of residence.
The state may require from you a general declaration signed by the pilot-in-command.

2sZVTos6.question: In which case should a Contracting State (of the Chicago Convention) waive the visa requirement for a crew member identifying him-/herself with a Crew Member Certificate (CMC)?

options.text: When arriving in a duty status on an international flight and seeking temporary entry.
When arriving in a duty status on an international flight and seeking permanent entry.
When arriving in an off-duty status on an international flight and seeking temporary entry.
When arriving in an off-duty status on an international flight and seeking permanent entry.

58jHbIAA.question: The Crew Member Certificate (CMC) shall be accepted by each Contracting State for identification purposes:

options.text: none of the above.
together with a valid passport.
together with a visa if required.
together with a valid flight crew license.

spsiBxkB.question: Refer to ICAO Annex 9. In general, when crew members enter or leave a member state, the state must...

options.text: facilitate and expedite their inspection as well as their baggage by checking their CMCs.
request a full visa in order to check if the person is a real crew member or not.
facilitate and expedite their luggage inspection, but not the inspection of the crew members, who are subject to the same provisions which apply for the passengers.
facilitate and expedite their inspection, but not the inspection of the crew members baggage, which is subject to the same provisions which apply for the passengers baggage.

Qmov6Xa2.question: In what kind of circumstances is a visa requirement waived for a crew member with a current CMC?

options.text: When entering on duty and seeking temporary access.
When entering off duty and seeking permanent access.
When entering on duty and seeking temporary access lasting not longer than 24 hours.
When entering off duty and seeking temporary access.

xz8vWklG.question: In the eventuality that unaccompanied baggage is to be loaded on an aircraft:

options.text: Baggage should be cleared under the procedure applicable to accompanied baggage or under another simplified custom procedure distinct from that normally applicable to other traffic.
No unaccompanied baggage is allowed to be carried.
Less restrictive scan of the baggage should be performed before it being loaded in the aircraft.
Baggage should be loaded in the cargo hold when covered by a traffic document.

lV7mmIOn.question: A passenger is found inadmissible. How long shall the removing state allow the operating carrier to effect that passenger's removel via its own services?

options.text: 24 hours.
48 hours.
36 hours.
12 hours.

hPLY4po9.question: How many copies of: (i) the general declaration (ii) the cargo manifest and (iii) the simple stores list are required on departure from an aircraft engaged in international air transport ?

yL0UBulV.question: Regarding passengers on commercial air transport operations and their cabin baggage, what security measures shall be taken prior to boarding an aircraft?

options.text: Screening of passengers and cabin baggage.
Random security interviews of passengers above the age of 18.
Manual search of all cabin baggage.
Background identity checks on all passengers.

gakmlRdM.question: In International Air Transport, the Crew Member Certificate (CMC) is used by a crew member for identification purposes

options.text: leaving the crew licence to serve its primary purpose of attesting to the professional qualifications of the flight crew member.
and is only valid when shown with a passport
at his/her homebase aerodrome only.
and is only valid when shown with the appropriate crew licence.

XlkgC7pY.question: How are Search & Rescue Regions in remote areas organised?

options.text: Regional air navigational agreements
IATA Search & Rescue Committee
They are not as they are too inaccessible
ICAO Search & Rescue Committee

bzUqKmTz.question: A person who is or will be refused by the authority to enter a state is called:

options.text: inadmissible person.
uncleared person.
refused person.
imposter.

IkqQgLaz.question: ATIS broadcast messages containing departure and arrival information should include cloud cover, when the clouds are

options.text: below 1 500 m (5.000 ft) or below the highest minimum sector altitude, whichever is the greater
below 900 m (3.000 ft) or below the highest minimum sector altitude, whichever is the greater
cumulonimbus
below 2 000 m (600 ft) or below the highest minimum sector altitude, whichever is the greater

5eyWmOkl.question: According to Annex 9 Facilitation, a cargo manifest declaration form

options.text: may be requested by contracting state
includes cargo and airway bill.
should always be provided.
includes list of passengers and their corresponding gate.

hyNGEbHX.question: When a person is found to be inadmissible and is returned to the aircraft operator for transport away from the territory of the state, the aircraft operator..

options.text: shall not be precluded from recovering from such person any transportation costs arising from the removal.
is not responsible for the inadmissibility of such person for entry in the receiving state and shall not be made responsible for the repatriation of such person.
shall not recover from such person any transportation costs arising from the removal.
and the state of the operator are both responsible for the inadmissible person.

UydYyHDC.question: When cargo, unaccompanied baggage or stores are not unladen at their intended destination but are unladen at another international airport, the Contracting State where the unloading takes place, if satisfied that there has been no gross negligence or carelessness by the operator:

options.text: shall not impose penalties, fines, customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties and fines but customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines and custom duties but taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines and taxes but custom duties on the operator.

spJHfSri.question: Select the correct statement about the obligation of the operator to remove any person found inadmissible from the territory of a Contracting State.

options.text: The obligation of the operator shall terminate, when such a person has been legally admitted entry into a State.
The obligation is with the Contracting State of the operator.
The obligation of the operator terminates when the person has left the aircraft and is in custody with the local Authority.
The operator has no obligation regarding the admittance of a person into the territory of a Contracting State.

y2lpCiaQ.question: When a passenger and his/her luggage arrive at an aerodrome, in ICAO Annex 9 provisions request the State to...

options.text: Adopt border control regulations appropriate to the air transport environment and prevent unnecessary delays.
Perform at least a double border control. For security reasons, the delays caused by these measures have NO limitation.
Give passengers with first class tickets priority over other passengers for their inspections as well as their luggage.
Prevent any delays for passengers due to the increase of the border and luggage controls.

7R9NO25f.question: A person of 13 years of age is defined as

options.text: an adult.
a child.
an adult if female only.
an adult if male only.

idTnKIcX.question: What should airfield signs be made out of to minimise damage to aircraft

options.text: Frangible
Rigid
Metal
Flexible

pMhttyk0.question: With regards to ICAO Annex 9, a General Declaration:

options.text: Must be presented to all contracting states requiring it
Shall be required by all states
Includes nature of cargo and waybill number
Includes passenger names and point of embarkment

sDdTDQV0.question: On departure, how many copies are required of the following documents: - General Declaration - Stores List - Cargo Manifest

options.text: 3 of each
1 of 1; 1 of 2; 2 of 3
2 of 1; 1 of 2; 2 of 3
2 of 1; 2 of 2; 3 of 3

8Vl8qWZE.question: A person attempting to enter the territory of a State has been confirmed as inadmissible. How much time does the Operator have to ensure the removal of this person?

options.text: The State consults the aircraft Operator and allows the Operator a reasonable amount of time.
The time frame for the removal is specified in ICAO Annex 9 (Facilitation).
The State determines the time frame for the removal, which is binding on the aircraft Operator.
The aircraft Operator determines how much time the removal requires and informs the State.

8jGLdDtM.question: Which are the national security programme requirements that an operator`s security programme shall meet?  The requirements from

options.text: any State from which the operator is flying.
the State of the Operator.
the aircraft`s State of Registry.
the United Nations` security programme.

aHPLCneY.question: The minimum age to hold a PART-FCL ATPL is

options.text: 21 years.
18 years.
23 years.

8Ky2v9ql.question: Who assists the authority in coordinating the implementation of security controls and procedures, as specified in the airport security programme?

options.text: The Airport Security Committee.

zEQZqOj8.question: ICAO Annex 9 Facilitation. â€“ A General Declaration for entry or departure of aircraft..

lists the goods carried as cargo and their Air Waybill Number.

Zg6B6MID.question: What is the purpose of a CMC?

options.text: To provide identification of aircrew.

iRubi0W5.question: According to ICAO Annex 9, who shall sign the general Declaration in paper form, if needed?

The Accountable Manager.

Personal belongings.
Any non-human, non-animal cargo.
Excess freight.
Any freight cargo not carried on by the person.

KejW5lSa.question: What is correct regarding the obligation of the operator to remove any person found inadmissible from the territory of a Contracting State?

options.text: The obligation of the operator shall terminate, when such a person has been legally admitted entry into a State.
The obligation is with the Contracting State of the operator.
The operator has no obligation regarding the admittance of a person into the territory of a Contracting State.
The obligation of the operator terminates when the person has left the aircraft and is in custody with the local Authority.

p9j06SLl.question: According to ICAO Annex 9, who is responsible for the production and presentation of the Cargo Manifest and the Air Waybill(s)?

options.text: The aircraft operator or its Authorised Agent.
The Load Master.

The Pilot-in-Command.

SLSituIc.question: The procedure for the pilot-in-command of an aircraft to be followed in case of intercepting a distress transmission is:

options.text: Record the position of the craft in distress if given, if possible take a bearing of the transmission, inform the appropriate RCC or ATS and, while awaiting instructions, proceed at your discretion towards the position given in the transmission
Hold at the position where the distress signal and/or message is received, co-ordinate the SAR operation by using the appropriate VHF and/or HF frequencies until released by a SAR unit.

Record the position of the craft in distress, take the bearing of transmission, inform the appropriate RCC or ATS using the appropriate VHF and/or HF frequencies, proceed on the most expeditious way towards the position given in transmission

Record the position of the transmission, proceed according to the flight plan, complete the SAR report form at the next airport, indicating where you can be reached in order to supply further information.

cTaPYyR1.question: Who is responsible for establishing facilities for the issue or the use of CMC?

options.text: Contracting States.
EASA.
ICAO.
IATA.

R0TRNn8w.question: On a general declaration form, the following data can be found:

passenger names, passenger addresses, and other personal data.

a complete description of payload (passengers, cargo, mail).

xJJLH0BK.question: Choose correct statement which describes the term 'inadmissible person':

options.text: A person who is or will be refused admission to a State by its authorities.

A person who is or will be refused admission to an aircraft.

GVYyrs89.question: When an unruly passenger endangers the safety of the aircraft, the aircraft commander

options.text: may disembark the unruly passenger in the territory of any State.
must disembark the unruly passenger in the State over which the unruly behaviour took place.

WUSOtDcR.question: Who shall facilitate and expedite the process under which aircraft operators based in their territories can apply for Crew Member Certificates (CMCs) for their crew members?

options.text: Contracting States
ICAO
EASA

6FWpNbE8.question: In cases where a visitor travelling by air holds a valid passport and no visa is required of him, Contracting States:

none of the answers are applicable.

4G0RtjOv.question: Following ICAO, from which age does a person need a passport to travel?

not be transmitted on the voice channel of an ILS.
not be transmitted on the voice channel of a VOR.
be transmitted on the voice channel of an ILS, on a discrete VHF frequency, or on the voice channel of a VOR.
only be transmitted on a discrete VHF frequency.

PwiLd9ZH.question: When can a contracting state (according to Chicago convention) request a visa from a crew member, in addition to the CMC certificate?

FcP6gAWH.question: For the transport of potentially disruptive passengers some supplementary safeguards are to be observed, such as:

18 years.
19 years.

Pmjb7F3x.question: An Integrated Aeronautical Information Package consists of the following elements

AIP, supplements to AIP; NOTAM and PIB; AIC and checklist summaries.
AIP, including amendment service, supplements to AIP; NOTAM; AIC and AIRAC.
AIP, including amendment service, supplements to AIP; NOTAM; AIC and checklist summaries.

options.text: each Contracting State.
ICAO.

Jc9rQoPe.question: In relation to the entry and departure of crew members in duty:

crew members must be in uniform to be allowed to temporary entry.
a contracting state is required to accept a flight crew license as identification.

xYKDYK3G.question: A passenger is found inadmissible. How long does the operator have to deport the PAX?

0HXLUuMx.question: When establishing security at an airport, what are the objectives (general principles) with regard to ICAO Annex 17?

options.text: Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel and the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers and crew in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.

Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew and ground personnel in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
